column4: Hi, I'm trying to use dpkg -r to remove a .deb that I installed, but it is telling me that the package hasn't been installed. Are there individual packages inside of one .deb, and if so, is there a way to list them?
- I get this: dpkg: you must specify packages by their own names, not by quoting the names of the files they come in
Not the file name of the .deb, just the package name like "ubuntu-desktop"
